item.description:
Revere Beach, the oldest public beach in America, celebrates its anniversary every year in August.

A recent revitalizing face lift has the beach looking great these days. Along the boulevard there is a bandstand for summer concerts, a couple of bathhouses and many pavilions where you can find shade and a place to sit and people watch.

Revere Beach is very accessible by from route one as well as public transportation in from the city.

We'll meet at the pavilion across from Kelly's and take in some shots of beach activity until dusk. They we'll get into place for the fireworks show.

We may adjust the time depending on updated information as the event comes closer. Please watch your email for updates during the summer.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the pavilion across from Kelly's
item.name: Revere Beach Fireworks
